title: Applying the reciprocal rule of derivation
text: Because the given equation in the form $$\frac{1}{f{\left(x\right)}}$$, we can use the reciprocal rule which states that $$\frac{d}{dx} \frac{1}{f{\left(x\right)}}=\frac{\left(-\operatorname{f'}\left(x\right)\right)}{{f{\left(x\right)}}^2}$$.

title: Derivative of inverse trigonometric functions:tan(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse tan(x) is $$\frac{d}{dx} {tan}^{\left(-1\right)} x=\frac{1}{1+x^2}$$.
speech: The formula for the derivative of inverse tan(x) is  fraction, d over, d x,  the parentheses negative 1  power of, tangent of x is equal to fraction, 1 over, 1 plus x squared,  .
